description: Three connected folios with mixed diagram types - NOT typical ring diagrams

scatter_area.encoding: 1 token per line (29 lines) - scattered positions
scatter_area.description: Circular area with tokens spread uniformly, NOT in rings

f68r1.notes: Diagram is NOT rings - tokens scattered like 'buckshot' in circular area

scatter_area.encoding: Mostly 1 token per line - scattered positions
scatter_area.description: Circular area with scattered tokens, NOT rings

outer_ring.encoding: All on line 1 = continuous circular text

inner_ring.encoding: All on line 1 = continuous circular text

f68r3.notes: More typical AZC structure - outer ring, spokes, inner ring, scattered fill

transcript_encoding_notes.scatter_tokens: When tokens are scattered (not sequential), each gets its own line number
transcript_encoding_notes.ring_tokens: When tokens form a continuous ring, they share the same line number
transcript_encoding_notes.spoke_tokens: Spoke lines each get a separate line number, with multiple tokens per spoke

user_observations: First 2 diagrams have Currier A-like paragraph above
First 2 diagrams are NOT rings - circular areas with scattered tokens
Third diagram (f68r3) is more typical: outer ring, spoke lines, internal ring
Scattered tokens appear between spokes on f68r3

oddities.description: Circular diagrams that are NOT organized as rings - tokens scattered uniformly
Paragraph text above diagrams that resembles Currier A
Ring + spoke + scatter hybrid - more complex than simple ring diagram
